intro: Pherotrichis mixtecana, commonly known as the Mixtecan pherotrich, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers. The plant is characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. It typically grows in dry, rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
